newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean won closes higher in lacklustre trading.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean won closes higher in lacklustre trading.

text.p: The won ended stronger versus the dollar on Tuesday in quiet, dull trading as some banks squared their long dollar holdings, dealers said.
The won closed at 827.60 after opening at 828.30. It moved in a range of 827.40 to 828.50.
"Trading was thin with most participants sitting sidelined," said a local dealer. "The market is still trapped between 825 and 830."
Dealers said the won was likely to trade in a range of 826.50 to 828.50 on Wednesday. The base mid-rate is seen at 827.80, unchanged from today's. -- JEAN YOON (822) 727 5643
